vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
τολυπ-εύω,
wind off carded wool into a clew for spinning, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II metaphorically, wind off, achieve, accomplish, ἐγὼ δὲ δόλους τολυπεύω, of Penelope's web (with a play on the literal sense), [Refs 8th c.BC+]; Φρῃξὶν πένθος τ. work them grief, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; δόμον τ. finish building it, [Refs]
__II.2 endure, ἐς γῆρας τ. ἀργαλέους πολέμους [Refs 8th c.BC+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: endure, wind off (at the end of weaving)
vocabInfos.mediumDef: endure, wind off (at the end of weaving)
